<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[47, 62, 460, 77]]<|/det|>
4 Hot water is poured into a glass beaker and allowed to cool down for 5 minutes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 89, 547, 103]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate whether the rate of cooling of the hot water depends upon the initial temperature of the hot water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 128, 409, 141]]<|/det|>
The rate of cooling of the water can be calculated using the equation:

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 145, 404, 175]]<|/det|>
\[
\text { rate of cooling }=\frac{\text { decrease in temperature }}{\text { time taken }} .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 179, 182, 194]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 205, 203, 220]]<|/det|>
- a supply of cold water - an electric kettle

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 230, 211, 246]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 270, 338, 285]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 296, 289, 310]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 375, 282, 389]]<|/det|>
sure your measurements are accurate - the variables you will control

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 399, 547, 416]]<|/det|>
- a results table to record your measurements (you are not required to enter any readings in the table)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[71, 426, 366, 442]]<|/det|>
